fields.description:
Please add a setting in bitbucket-pipelines.yml to allow docker images to be started with the "--privileged" flag.

Use: privileged flag allows network configuration needed for VPN connection used for deployment to dev/qa server.
fields.summary: Allow Docker Image "--privileged" Flag

Hi,

While trying to push my commits to repo, I am getting no space left on the device.

fields.description:
When I use the "stop" button to cancel a build, I get a failure notification email. Either there should be no email, or it should have a difference subject like:

"pipeline build for my_branch cancelled"

Currently it is identical to all other failure emails, making it impossible to distinguish which are actual failure which need investigation.
fields.summary: Don't send failure reports for manually stopped build

fields.description:
So somehow I have  associated Atlassian and Bitbucket accounts but each is associated with different email.\\
The problem is that now I unable to change email on bitbucket to be the same as on artisian because  system reports that emai already used. If I change the picture it must be changed via Atlassian and not updated on bitbucket
fields.summary: Atlassian and bitbucket account email association, data inconsistency

fields.description: I can use Raw button to delete some file but there  is no way how to download a directory. I know that it is possible to download complete repository. But I have some folder and I want its content and I do not want to check out the repository.
fields.summary: Download directory as zip file

fields.description: Google analytics may have prevent Bitbucket from loading in China without a VPN. Perhaps by putting the google analytics script tag at the end of page will help solving this issue.
fields.summary: Edit Google Analytics script position to allow Bitbucket to load in China.

fields.description:
For example, as a reviewer, you have a branch with 10 commits, after a few commits the pull request becomes pretty long and you're not particularly concerned with all of the changes, you're only concerned with the ongoing changes.

Very frequently I find myself viewing the "activity" tab of a pull request and viewing new, individual, commits and adding my comments there.

However, the comments that I add to an individual commit don't appear in the pull request itself, so inevitably I need to go through and copy all of my comments, find the relevant file in the pull request diff and add the comment a second time.

Since all new commits to a branch are considered a part of the pull request, so should all comments for each of those commits.

I understand this functionality was implemented in Bitbucket Server 4.8:\\
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BitbucketServer/Bitbucket+Server+4.8+release+notes#BitbucketServer4.8releasenotes-Reviewpullrequestsatthecommitlevel

Accidentally logged this over at https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BSERV-9231
fields.summary: In a pull request, display any comments from commits to the same branch.

fields.description: Is it possible to add Qt language(framework) into the dropdown menu Language? I think, that many people use this framework, so it will be nice to have it there. In my opinion it's not good to mark Qt source code as C++. Qt has many own classes and types so it looks like another language.
fields.summary: Add Qt language

fields.description: It's nice that PIpelines sends mails of failures. But it would be nicer if it sent them also for the first success after failures, so one could get instant notifications when things are back to normal instead of having to find it out by other means.
fields.summary: Send notification of first successful build after failures

fields.description:
{{conq: unhandled exception}}

This error occurs when cloning the git-lfs objects from a repo using a deployment key.
fields.summary: Cannot clone git-lfs objects using deployment keys

fields.description: Many CI environments such as for example Travis, Codeship, CircleCI, Appveyor etc set the CI=true environment variable for their builds by default. Having Bitbucket pipelines do the same would ease transition/portability. (Sure, it can be configured in Bitbucket settings or the pipelines yml file, but I think this is something that would be good to set automatically by default.)
fields.summary: Add default "standard" CI=true environment variable

fields.description:
*Summary*

Users find themselves trying to enable Pipelines inside repositories that they have access but after pressing the "Enable pipelines" button nothing happens, the snipper appears and never stops. This is happening because the user does not have administrative access to the repository, only users with admin access can enable Pipelines.

*Steps to Reproduce*

# Access a repository w/o administrative access.
# Click Pipelines under the "Navigation" menu at the sidebar on the left.
# Press the "Enable Pipelines" option.

*Expected Results*

A warning message show appear and inform the user that he can't enable Pipelines because he don't have permission and should contact the repository admin.

*Actual Results*

The user clicks "Enable pipelines" and nothing happens, the snipper appears and never goes away. No messages appear to inform the user why/what went wrong.
fields.summary: Unable to enable Pipelines without administrative access (BBCI-3240)

fields.description: I'm using CMake in most of my C/C++ projects. It works pretty much like Makefile test {{./configure; make; make test}} only the first step is {{cmake .}} instead.
fields.summary: Add an example CMake configuration file
Repository names greater than 62 characters are truncated

fields.description:
This appears to be a fairly new issue.  When you click the create pull request button in Safari (v9.0.3) on Mavericks, the PR page never finishes populating.  I was able to create the PR in Firefox, which pre-populates the title and description fields and adds the diff and and other tabs at the bottom.  Here's a redacted screencap:

!3002051663-unable-to-create-pr.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Unable to create a pull request using Safari

fields.description:
Just recently, your team added 'Pipelines' under the Navigation submenu for every project. It doesn't matter if the project is a Windows, iOS, or OSX build. Everyone gets to see this new menu option regardless if their project can use Pipelines or if it's enabled.

I propose that when Pipelines is disabled for a project, it gets hidden under the Navigation submenu instead of making it a permanent feature under navigation that probably a sizable amount of projects hosted on BitBucket can't support (or have disabled for their project). Once enabled, Pipelines could then be visible under Navigation. I have no problem with Pipelines or its visibility for projects that can utilize it and that it's enabled for. I have a problem with it being visible for every single project even if it's not enabled and the Pipelines cannot support the project.
fields.summary: Move location of Pipelines when not enabled

fields.description:
git clone git@bitbucket.org:meetliquid/meetliquid.com.git\\
Cloning into 'meetliquid.com'...\\
ssh: connect to host bitbucket.org port 22: Network is unreachable\\
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

Please make sure you have the correct access rights\\
and the repository exists.
fields.summary: Can't clone repo on local

fields.description:
Customer reported:

bq. Tried to import SVN repository to Bitbucket Cloud using SVN import tools (*Repositories>Import Repository*) and received Password Mismatched error.\\
Have tried to reset the account password but the issue persists.


bq. From the svn server apache2 error.log:\\
"[Mon Sep 19 21:39:47 2016] [error] [client 104.192.143.193] user murray: authentication failure for "/svn/sobs/trunk": Password Mismatch"


This is related to BBS-40140
fields.summary: SVN import function failed to authenticate against user's SVN server

fields.description:
Currently when creating a service to trigger a build / plan in Bamboo, there is no way to test that the connection is successful with the provided URL and authentication details beyond pushing a commit and seeing if it builds.

As a user, I'd like a way to perform a basic test from the UI to confirm connectivity and successful authentication.
fields.summary: As a user when creating a Service to trigger my Bamboo Server, I'd like to be able to test the connection

fields.description:
Imagine a feature/x branch forked from the develop branch.\\
After some commits, a pull request is submitted, and the reviewers comment on some issues.\\
The submitter does an interactive rebase and fixed the offending/problematic commits - and then does a force push.

The reviewer would like to know what changed, but that is currently not available.\\
With tracking branches the branch before the force push would be preserved as "feature/x@20161006215817" and the bitbucket UI for the pull request could have a button "Compare to previous force push" that shows the difference between the old "feature/x@20161006215817" from before the force push, and the new "feature/x" after the force push. That difference would show the changes clearly.
fields.summary: Tracking branch changes across force pushes

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When changing the owner of a repository Pipelines losses the ability to render past build results and environment variables defined in Pipelines settings.

h3. How to Replicate

# Create repository
# Enable Pipelines
# Create environment variable
# Commit a few items to the recently created repository
# Move repository under a different owner or create a new repository importing from this one
# Enable Pipelines (bitbucket-pipelines.yaml should already exist)
# Attempt to view a previous result

* left hand panel fails with Failed to load resource\\
Example:\\
url: https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/pipelines-examples-googleappengine/addon/pipelines/home#!/results/%7B77f5e86d-7d54-4c45-8231-8bf75ccad3ec%7D\\
Error:

{code}
#!json

{"message": "Pipeline with UUID '{77f5e86d-7d54-4c45-8231-8bf75ccad3ec}' not found.", "arguments": {"uuid": "{77f5e86d-7d54-4c45-8231-8bf75ccad3ec}"}, "key": "result-service.pipeline.not-found"}
{code}

# Enviroment variables are not imported
fields.summary: Changing repository owner causes build history loss in Pipelines

fields.description:
We'd like to request a feature to limit the number of concurrent builds running in Pipelines.

We're trying to switch to Pipelines from Bamboo to run and deploy all of our Maven builds, but have realized that if multiple developers happen to trigger builds that run concurrently we'll get unpredictable results if the builds attempt to deploy at the same time.

Being able to limit the number of concurrent builds for a branch would be extremely helpful.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Limit Number of Concurrent Builds via Config File

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
User not able to set the multiple permission for Master branch using Branch Permission:

* Master branch can be written by all members
* Only certain user can rewrite branch history and delete master branch.

h3. Expected current result
Whenever user _Add a new branch permission_, it overwrites the existing permission for that branch.\\
!2025598349-Branch%20permission.gif|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested result
It will be best that users able to create multiple permission for the same branch
fields.summary: Customer Request: Ability to add multiple permission for the same branch

fields.description: Before the branch UI changes, you were given the # of affected branches for each restriction line item that you had configured based on your branch or pattern config.  Currently, you are now shown the pattern, but not the # of branches that are actually affected.
fields.summary: New branch restrictions UI does not show branch count.

fields.description:
I am migrating my personal two factor tokens from one authenticator app to another. Most implementations for this allow me to "reset", "regenerate" or "replace" a token and in doing so invalidate the previous app.

On bitbucket the only option I can see is to disable two factor and re-enable it which will mean having to re-enroll my U2F token as well.

We really should support rotating app's rather than requiring a full tear down.
fields.summary: As a user I want to add a new two factor app without disabling two factor

fields.description: See BCLOUD-13376 for example
fields.summary: Code block in issue description sits on top of issue details box if too long

fields.description:
We're in the process of delegating more power and responsibility to our development teams.

One thing missing is the ability for them to manage the members of their own group. The current *manage* permission gives the team to much power, it allows them to manage all groups instead of just their own group.
fields.summary: Allow user group to only manage their own group

fields.description: Pipelines should support emoji in task name like the pull request titles and the commit messages.
fields.summary: Support Bitbucket emojis like :tada: in Pipelines commit messages

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After pushing .exe and .dll file type to repository using Git LFS, Git LFS page (*Repo Settings>Git LFS*) shows those files as _Unknown_

###Steps to Reproduce

# Add the following code into .gitattributes\\
*.exe filter=lfs diff=lfs merge=lfs -text\\
*.dll filter=lfs diff=lfs merge=lfs -text
# Add, commit push a file (.exe and .dll)
# Navigate to *Repo Settings>Git LFS*

###Expected Results\\
Shows .exe or .dll as file type

###Actual Results\\
File type shows as *Unknown*
fields.summary: Unable to see .exe and .dll file type in Git LFS setting page

fields.description: please fix asap
fields.summary: Advanced Search is not working correctly anymore

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Alice creates a private repository, and gives Bob read permission.
# Bob privately forks Alice's repository. Alice does not have read permission on Bob's repository.
# Bob commits to his repository.
# Bob opens a pull request from his repository into Alice's repository.
# Alice views the pull request, and taps the "Show more lines" button.

Expected: more context is shown\\
Actual: nothing happens. Chrome developer tools - Network tab indicates a 500 error

{code}
https://bitbucket.org/!api/1.0/repositories/ALICE/REPO/pullrequests/1/_context/path/to/file.cpp?below_fnum=34&below_tnum=41
{"error": {"message": "\"no commit or repo found for u'BOB/REPO+6661xxxxf04a'\"", "id": "6ad1xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxca8c"}}
{code}
fields.summary: Show more lines gives 500 error if reviewer cannot read source repo

fields.description:
As the title says, if a repo has a file with a {{\n}} in its name, Bitbucket errors out on all pages where that filename would have to be converted to a URL. This includes the source and changeset views (amongst other views, I'm sure).

Fortunately, this is not very common.
fields.summary: Don't 500 when a repository contains files with a newline character in their name

fields.description:
git push --set-upstream origin test/overflow\\
Counting objects: 3, done.\\
Delta compression using up to 8 threads.\\
Compressing objects: 100% (3/3), done.\\
remote: error: unable to create temporary file: No space left on device\\
remote: fatal: failed to write object
fields.summary: Getting Remote error when pushing

fields.description: This feature is more needed for bitbucket, but I'd love the ability to login to multiple accounts at once, and toggle/switch between them (just like google account switcher works). There are many situations where I need to toggle back & forth between company accounts and user accounts, and right now logging out, logging back in is a time impediment when this has to be done often and frequently.
fields.summary: Switch between Atlassian accounts

fields.description:
When incrementing a variable using the following syntax:

((VARIABLE++))

The pipelines build fails

I had to use VARIABLE=$((VARIABLE+1)) instead.
fields.summary: Variable increment fails

fields.description:
It is possible to add an SSH key to a team account. However, it is not possible to restrict write permissions for an SSH key.

[This article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/ssh-access-keys-for-system-use-776639781.html] indicates it is possible to do the equivalent thing on Bitbucket Server.

SSH keys added to a team are useful for granting some other server or application access to the team's repositories, but when that external application only requires read access, this authentication method fails the [principle of least privilege|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Principle_of_least_privilege].

A workaround is to create a resource user for the application and assign them to the Viewer group, but this is non-optimal since users on Bitbucket teams can come at cost.
fields.summary: Add permission setting for team SSH keys

fields.description:
If branch being reviewed by a pull request happens to be closed and merged back to the target branch _outside_ of BitBucket's Pull Request, the only way to close the Pull Request is to "decline" it. This makes it look like the change was rejected, when in fact it was accepted.

Most of the time, our devs want to just use the "merge" button for a Pull Request to merge back to the target branch, but we can't guarantee that's always the case. For example if a there are conflicts in the merge to the target branch, they'll have to be resolved locally and the user may want to just handle the merge back to the target branch at the same time. Having to mark the pull request as "declined" in this case leaves a false trail of history that makes it look like the change should have been rejected rather than accepted.
fields.summary: Allow pull requests to be closed without "declining" after a branch is closed & merged locally.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
While inserting website without _https://_ or _http://_, "_Please enter a URL_" error message is prompt.\\
!4262164165-WebsiteErrorMessage.gif|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solution
It will be best that it will prompt a more helpful message to request user to include HTTP/HTTPS protocol
fields.summary: Suggestion on Website input error message on Bitbucket Profile settings page

fields.description:
Now that [12784|BCLOUD-12784] is resolved, users can receive:

* all failure notifications _OR_
* just failures triggered by that user (i.e., personal failure notifications)

I would like to be able to configure notifications at the same level of granularity that Bamboo provided.  Bamboo allowed notifications to be configured by selecting one of the following three options (per environment):

* Deployment started and finished
* Deployment finished
* Deployment failed
fields.summary: Notifications for Deployments

fields.description:
Ability to temporarily collapse a comment thread in pull request UI in order to keep the flow of code visible.\\
In some circumstances, comment threads can grow very large. What ends up happening is everyone who looks at the PR gravitates to the comments and ignores potential bugs within 10 lines of the discussion.\\
It would be nice to be able to hide a given comment thread so issues near discussions are more apparent.
fields.summary: Ability to collapse comment threads

fields.description:
On https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issues/1, the "Log in to comment" URL is almost 3 kilobytes long and it looks like this:\\
{{https://bitbucket.org/account/signin/?next=%3Cbound%20method%20WSGIRequest.get_full_path%20of%20%3CWSGIRequest%0Apath%3A/site/master/issues/1%2C%0AGET%3A%3CQueryDict}} ... I don't think that's right.
fields.summary: bogus "Log in to comment" link

Hi,

The "disk full" issue is back :

Wiser.

fields.description: Receiving 500 errors, with codes when trying to load snippets.
fields.summary: 500 error trying to load snippets.

fields.description: Currently, when you work on a branch and push this up, we will send a remote message about creating a pull request. An expanded feature could be adding the address to the parent fork of this repo (if applicable), instead of just the parent repo.
fields.summary: Add in parent fork pull request address for Git's remote push message

fields.description: As of now all files trigger the build. It would be great to be able to trigger the build only when a specific file changes, or exclude files from triggering the build. For example, when project.json changes do not trigger a build. This can be useful when keeping npmjs up to date with the latest version and the project.json file needs its version saved within source control (which would then trigger another build).
fields.summary: For pipelines, as a user I want to be able to include/exclude files that trigger the build

fields.description:
Hi,

On our project works a lot of developers in the same repo,

and one of them occasionally have deleted one important branch in the common remote repo.

Can I find that person ?

It will be great to see history of deleted branches (branch-name, person-name, datetime)
fields.summary: How can I view list (history) of deleted branches

fields.description:
I have a Docker image I want to use: https://hub.docker.com/r/xueshanf/s3fs/

The image will mount an S3 bucket for me. I think this image can be really helpful for running Maven builds that like to download the world. Here I can have a custom settings.xml point to the S3 bucket where all my external dependencies exist. My build / deploy time would dramatically go down.

There are a few caveats on how I would securely configure the container. It requires that the host has a .s3fs file containing my AWS access and secret keys. I could host the image in a private repository but that's not ideal if this is going to be a solution for all your users.

I'd love some feedback on what you think about this solution and how you could potentially add it to Bitbucket Pipelines.

Cheers,\\
Bjorn
fields.summary: Pipeline Docker image that mounts S3 repository
Can NOT access repository via IPv6

fields.description:
url : https://bitbucket.org/georgeeeb/suitableyou\\
hash : 6647a59290b64cdfbd25a0a8a5b917e7
fields.summary: error 500 in my repo

fields.description:
I recently delegated account administration of our bitbucket account and removed my administrator privileges. I realized that I was doing a lot of things that I didn't have the privileges to do, but could do because I was the account administrator.

I should have to escalate my privileges and put in my password again to use the site as an account administrator, rather than just have them when I'm logged in normally.
fields.summary: Account administrators should only have to put in their password again to escalate their privilegs

fields.description: You are able to go through the UI menu, and process to initiate a transfer form a personal account to a team account.  However, notifications are never sent, or received for the transfer.  This includes notifications to the bitbucket inbox, and email inboxes for the admin/owners of the team.  This only occurs specifically when the original owner of the repo is also the owner, or admin of the team the repo is being transferred to.
fields.summary: Unable to transfer repositories from personal account to team account. (BBCDEV-3044)

fields.description: For working at night.
fields.summary: please provive optional dark theme for ui

fields.description:
I was referred here by a staff response because I couldn't see anywhere obvious to make suggestions, and instinctively clicked the help / support section.

Maybe it's just me, but would be useful to help a simple 'suggestion' button on the menu bar which would open a small text window for posting quick suggestions.
fields.summary: Make issue tracker more obvious / simpler

fields.description:
On the Project edit page, the text entry field for project key displays all input in upper-case (capital) letters.

I mistakenly pressed {{Caps Lock}} before entering text into this field and discovered my resulting key was in lower case. Disabling caps lock and entering a new key also resulted in an all-lower-case key being saved (odd!). Attempting a third time with caps lock disabled but {{Shift}} held for some of the letters resulted in a mixed-case key.

I don't mind having keys forced to upper-case but being able to mistakenly set lower- or mixed-case values should not be allowed.

related? BCLOUD-12397
fields.summary: Case inconsistencies with project keys

fields.description:
Currently, Bitbucket does not allow users to add an entire team account/team group to a repo -- the user will have to add user accounts directly... or create a group and add users to the group to allow users in a team account into the repo.

*Use Case:*

# A user wants to grant access to the entire client's team account/team group to a repo under the user account
# On current settings, the user will have to know the details (username) of all users in the client's team account to be able to grant them access to the repo
# It will be great if the user will be able to add the entire team to the repo just by adding the team name -- or being able to add a group in a team account without the client being a member in the team themselves
fields.summary: Allow users to add permissions to an entire team to a repo

fields.description:
If you look at a user's page you can see the teams he or she is part of, but I would like to see *all the repositories this person has access to* as well. And in what way this person has access, whether it's through a group or he/she's directly configured as a user in the repository permissions.

Whenever someone leaves our company we have to go through hundreds of repositories to see if this person's access has been revoked completely. This extra tab would make handling that scenario much easier.
fields.summary: Add repositories tab to user section

fields.description:
Just like branch permissions allow you to set any team with at least write permissions to the repository it would be nice to allow a team (probably with at least read permissions) to be set as reviewers.

This makes it much easier to maintain a large number of repositories and a constant change of team members.
fields.summary: Allow a team to be set for default reviewers

fields.description: We have a plugin in which we are using Bootstrap modal to create a popup, but we wanted to move to Dialog module instead. But webItem is creating new item in ui (e.g. in repository navigation pane). Because we are requesting for added ability to create Dialog module in Bitbucket connect add-on
fields.summary: Allow connect add-ons to create Dialog module

fields.description: Currently, BitBucket doesn't render ORG files to HTML. It'll be best if we can render them.
fields.summary: Support and render .org files

fields.description: See attached video. Possibly related to https://bitbucket.atlassian.net/browse/BB-15045
fields.summary: Adding binary files to snippets fails if they're over a couple of mb

fields.description:
Hi Team,

I would like to view all the commit from all the repository in a single page. It's very difficult to us check developer commit time in every repository.

Thanks\\
Harish
fields.summary: Commit Report

fields.description: Similar to the browse repo option on the main dash, it would b nice to have this for projects, as some teams have many projects, and it is difficult to browse through them.
fields.summary: Add an option to browse projects on the main dashboard. (customer request).

fields.description: Currently, the dropdown only shows the last 5 recently viewed projects.  Can we expand this?
fields.summary: Expand the recently viewed projects in the dropdown to more than 5. (customer request)

fields.description: Placeholder for Azure / Microsoft update. Azure is currently utilizing POST hooks which will timeout, and not trigger.
fields.summary: Azure needs to update to webhooks

fields.description:
If you spend a lot of time in lengthy pull requests, scrolling down and reviewing code, only to have to scroll all the way back up to the top in order to merge or decline the request.

Would it be possible to either add a "back to top" button somewhere as you scroll down, or make the "merge, decline etc" header static as you scroll down so it is always visible.

It's a small change but would make a big difference to us when reviewing code.
fields.summary: Add a "Back to Top" button or static header to Pull Request review pages. (customer request)

fields.description: !2895020207-bitbucket%20but.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Branch Management modal overflows window and doesn't scroll

fields.description: After the commit and push from my local when i checked my commits in repo, there was no code difference. The changed code was not reflecting and place was completely empty. But it was there when i checked in my source files.
fields.summary: changes not shown in commit history but are there in source file

fields.description: Right now we only give an SSH URL.
fields.summary: Give instructions for SSH and HTTPS during new repo creation

fields.description:
On https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/overview , trying to cmd+click on the other tabs such as "Repositories" or "Issues", in an attempt to open in new browser tabs/windows, no longer works. It looks like there is some javascript that intercepts the click and does an ajax + pushstate update of the page.

It would be great if the cmd+click functionality could be restored.

Chrome 53, macOS 10.12.
fields.summary: Cannot cmd+click dashboard tabs to open in new browser tab

Hello.\\
Today when I try to pull I get error Error downloading object.\\
When i try to download it from web page(GitLFS->select file-> download) but get Unable to access the site(ERR_CONNECTION_CLOSED).
fields.summary: Git LFS does not work.

fields.description:
Just a small nice to have that would make our build a little nicer.

If we could access the url of the currently running build from an env variable we'd be able to make the notifications that go to our team room, be able to link to the build that caused it.
fields.summary: Expose current build URL through an env variable

fields.description:
On creating a branch with duplicate name should provide the user with error saying the same,\\ Right now it doesn't do anything User can click on the button multiple times. under Networks it says Bad Request - 400 with a html body response saying {code} #!html Oops! Looks like something went wrong.

Oops! Looks like your browser sent us wrong request.

{code} This is for Atlassian Bitbucket v4.6.3
fields.summary: Creating a Branch with duplicate name doesnt provide any error

fields.description:
I have enabled pipelines and I find that even with a small java project that I am not able to follow the log in the the pipelines log view (follow as in it should keep up with the output and always show the latest). The message I’ve get is "too much info, download raw".

Maybe we could improve the log output showing the last part. The last part is the interesting part. Containing\\
build successful or some error.
fields.summary: Improve Pipelines logs

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Assume that you have a team with the maximum number of users that the billing plan allows, e.g. a team on the 5 user plan, with 5 users in it. One of those 5 users has direct repo access only, and doesn't belong to any team user groups.

If you send this user an email invitation to another repo of the team, then the user will see the following when accepting the invite:
!2377382428-Screen%20Shot%202016-09-22%20at%2016.14.23.png|thumbnail!

That's even though his account already counts towards this team's users.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a team in Bitbucket -- the team will be by default on free 5 user plan
# Create two private repos in the team, repoA and repoB
# Add 3 users to one of your team's User Groups (including yourself, that will be 4 users in total)
# Afterwards, add a 5th user directly to repoA, from this repo's {{Settings >> Access Management}}
# Then, go to repoB, and open its {{Overview}} page
# At the top right corner of the page, there will be a link to Send Invitation to users: !3546174972-Screen%20Shot%202016-09-22%20at%2018.58.39.png|thumbnail!
# Select that, and in the popup that opens, select the tab {{Repository}}
# Add the 5th user's _email_ (not his username) and then send the invite

h3. Expected Results
The 5th user is able to accept the invitation.

h3. Actual Results
When the 5th user tries to accept the invitation for repoB, he sees this message:
!2377382428-Screen%20Shot%202016-09-22%20at%2016.14.23.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
Add the user's Bitbucket username directly to the repository's {{Settings >> Access Management}} page.
fields.summary: Sending an email invitation to a user that already has team repo access, and the team is on its user limit, doesn't work

fields.description: If I issue a 3 pull requests to master for 3 different branches, and each is merged in short sequence, it triggers three pipelines from the master branch, with no real order to which one runs first.  This can cause them to execute out of order, resulting in an incorrect state at the end of the final pipeline completing, whichever that ends up being.
fields.summary: Pipelines for a single branch should pull a specific commit and queue

fields.description:
We have a coding standard that says "Any line of code may be maximum 80 chars long". For some modules this should be 78.

Since the review pane doesn't display anything about line length, it's not possible to adhere to this standard.

The review pane should be able to show a marker at any specified line length.
fields.summary: Long lines indication.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Customers are confused about the warning message shows on Service Page as the services that they are using might not be related.

h3. Suggested Solution
Instead of showing the warning message on Services page, it will be best to show the warning message while user creating a *POST/Pull Request POST* service or there's an existence of those services in the repository.
fields.summary: Suggestion on the warning message in repository's Services page

fields.description:
I would like to be able to attach webhooks that automatically apply to all repositories in a team, including subsequently-created repositories.

The particular usage I have in mind is scanning all commits for things that look like API keys (eg. AWS IAM keys that look like AKIAxxxxxxxx), and taking some action on them, eg. notification, revocation, etc.

I can work around this by writing an app that uses the BitBucket API to scan for repositories that don't have a particular webhook, and fixing them appropriately. I have previously done exactly this, in fact. However this is pretty messy.
fields.summary: Team-level webhooks capability

fields.description: I was pretty shocked when Pipelines builds were not being triggered by a pull request. It was only triggered AFTER the PR was merged, which in my opinion completely defeats the point of a build. The whole idea is that you're not supposed to allow code INTO the codebase if it's not validated by a build. Now if a PR gets merged and the build fails I no longer have a pristine codebase. Please address. Pipelines is useless to me without this feature.
fields.summary: Trigger Pipelines build for Pull Requests.

fields.description: I set up a private repository on my account, which I had my teammate clone on his account.  He can send a pull request to me, but I can't send a pull request to him.  His fork doesn't show up in the pull request dialog, and I can't find a way to add his repository.  Is there any way around this?
fields.summary: Teammate's fork doesn't appear in pull request dialog

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce:*

# Create a new pull request or edit an existing an existing pull request on a repo
# Try to add a team member, who has a name which first name and last name has less than 3 characters (For example: Su Yu) by typing the name into the Reviewer's textbox

*Expected Result:*\\
The user's name should show up in the reviewer's dropdown, where it's possible to add the user to add as a reviewer of the pull request

*Actual Result:*\\
The user's name does not show up on the dropdown when typing in the name... making it not possible to pick the user to add as a reviewer.

Workaround: Just copy the affected user's full name and paste it on the Reviewer's field instead of trying to type the name into the textbox – the user's name should show up in the dropdown if you paste the full name directly on there
fields.summary: Not possible to add a user as a reviewer on a pull request, if the user's name has less than 3 characters

fields.description: Some files are huge in size and it would be a tremendous help if we could collapse files in pull requests so that one file doesn't take up a huge amount of the vertical space.
fields.summary: Customer Request: Ability to collapse files in Pull Requests

fields.description:
Test case:

# Create a PR with few commits,
# Review
# Add some new commits with new impacted files

Result: commits are listed in the 'Commits' pane for the PR, but the newly updated files aren't in the 'Overview'

Expected: Any file updated in commits included in the PR should show up.
fields.summary: Some files do not show up in the Pull request overview

fields.description:
Hi am getting message below when i try to add a user to our repository.

Not enough users on plan. The owner of this repository (isobaruk) will need to upgrade their plan before this action can be completed

I removed some of the users to allow new user to get access but it seems that is not working or updated rightly.

Could you please check.

Repo : https://bitbucket.org/isobaruk/western-union-chain-of-betters
fields.summary: Not enough users on plan

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce:*

# Go to an open issue on the issue tracker.
# Click "Resolve", close modal window by hitting the Esc button.
# Click "More", let the dropdown menu stay open.
# Click with left mouse button in free space outside of more.

As a result, the entire page will have faded background -- there is no way to get rid of this except by reloading the page.

!4205544418-NtLCpdUxoW.gif|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Bug with faded background on Bitbucket's issue tracker

fields.summary: Webhook page fails to load completely

fields.description:
If a user tries to view the Pipelines status on the repo overview page on Safari, they will see an error message 'CANNOT RETRIEVE PIPELINES' instead

!153008772-Screen%20Shot%202016-09-20%20at%203.57.52%20PM.png|thumbnail!

The Pipelines status overview works correctly on different browsers (Chrome, Firefox) though
fields.summary: Bitbucket Pipelines Overview doesn't show correctly on Safari

fields.description:
Right now it seems that if someone adds you as a reviewer and you don't have write access on that repo (to edit the PR) you cannot remove yourself from the reviewers list.

I have been added as a reviewer to a PR on a repo where I only have read access and there's no way for me to remove myself from that reviewers list and so that PR is always visible on the dashboard without anything that I can do.
fields.summary: Add the ability to remove yourself as a reviewer without repo write access

fields.description:
h3. Problem
When using the repository importer, if a URL contains a leading or trailing whitespace, the validation for the field fails with an unexpected error.

!https://monosnap.com/file/kk5B9cAJ5CeToRmIlSnaqVj0psbKMZ.png!

!https://monosnap.com/file/4CnVxWVpqDHpwhBDelYL72jnBUymMC.png!

h3. Expected Result
A git URL with leading or trailing spaces causes no validation errors.

h3. Suggested Fix
One of:

* Leading and trailing spaces are stripped from the git URL; or
* Provide a better validation message suggesting the URL is invalid (if a trailing whitespace is required it should probably be percent-encoded).
fields.summary: Leading and trailing spaces should be stripped from the repository importer's URL field

fields.description:
I would like to create a new Version in my JIRA project, every-time someone pushes a tag in the master branch. Additionally it would be great to configure a tag pattern.

perhaps allow this through commit message syntax.
fields.summary: Allow automatic new version creation in JIRA when new tag is pushed to repository in Bitbucket Cloud.  (customer request)

fields.description: This just seems wrong. If you look at my [test repo|https://bitbucket.org/seanfarley/test-issue-closes2/issues/2/something-broke-again], you can see that the issue is marked resolved / closed before it was merged to master.
fields.summary: Issues are closed even when they are referenced from a non-main branch

fields.description:
When cloning a large repository, we get the following:\\
abort: stream ended unexpectedly (got 495630 bytes, expected 1378316)

This is causing issues with various tools including our setup for builds. Workaround seems to be to clone incrementally but not an option in certain situations.
fields.summary: abort: stream ended unexpectedly on large repository
Commit link in an issue is formatted incorrectly

fields.description:
For our team's usage, we would prefer that the overall build status for a pull request or branch reflect build status of the last commit of the branch.\\
Currently it shows a failed build status even if there is a newer build on a newer commit in that branch which passes.

For example, if I have a branch called "new_feature" with the following commits (oldest first):

* commit BCLOUD-1, build passes
* commit BCLOUD-2, build fails
* commit BCLOUD-3, build passes

The current behaviour is:\\
When I go to the "branches" page of my repo on the Bitbucket web UI, the build status of "new_feature" branch is "failed" because there was at least one failed build from commit BCLOUD-2. \\
When I open a new pull request on that branch the build status is "failed" (same reason).

Our desired behaviour is:\\
When I go to the "branches" page, the build status of "new_feature" branch is "passed" because the build for the newest commit (#3) passed which supersedes the failed build from commit BCLOUD-2. \\
When I open a new pull request on that branch the build status is "passed" (same reason).
fields.summary: Use latest commit for build status of pull request or branch
